text: While considering the greater good is important, we must not lose sight of the fact that protecting and expanding civil liberties is crucial for upholding the values of justice and human rights. By safeguarding these liberties, we ensure that individuals are able to express themselves freely, participate in democratic processes, and hold those in power accountable. Limiting civil liberties in the name of the greater good can set a dangerous precedent and erode the foundations of a democratic society.
